msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 126 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4564; Qurʾānic Text: Q 49:1-64:18; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 200 x 120mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 24f: "72 Y. 4564. Aynı. Parşömen. 120mm boy ve 200mm eninde cönk şeklinde 126 yaprak. Sahifede kûfi yazı ile 140mm uzunl.[uğunda] 7 satır. Tahminen IV. (X) asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Baştan 2 ve sondan iki zahriye mustatil şeklinde olup hendesi ve geçme şekillerle müzehheptir; güller ve sure başları da aynı üslûpta tezhip edilmiştir. I. ʿAbdülhamid’in vakıf kaydını ve mührünü havidir. Vişne çürüğü ve kırmızı deri üzerine yekşah tezhipli cilt. Bu mushaf Ḥucurat (49) suresinin başından Tagabun (64) suresi sonuna kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "72 Y. 4564. Same. Parchment. 126 junk shaped leaves of 120 mm height and 200 mm width. The text area, written in Kufic script [contains] 7 lines measuring 140 mm. Probably copied during the 4th (10th) century. The first and the last two rectangular zahriyes are decorated with geometric and interlaced forms. Roses and the sūra beginnings are decorated in the same style. Contains waqf registration and seal of ʿAbdulḥamid I. Cherry brown binding with yekshah illuminations on red leather. This fragment is from the beginning of Q 49 (Sūra al-Ḥucurāt), until the end of Q 64 (Sūra al-Taghābūn).”
